result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven D. Beach was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Steven D. Beach is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Steven D. Beach was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Steven D. Beach
Current: 23092 Comar Lane, Richland Center, WI 53581 United States  (Effective: 02-25-2015)
Prior: 23092 Comar Lane #22, Richland Center, WI 53581

Defendant Steven D. Beach in court with attorney Peter A. Bartelt. Prosecuting Atty Amy Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  14CF29 and 14CT16 called together for plea/sentencing.

Atty. B informs the Court that the parties have reached an agreement to resolve both cases.  Per Atty. B, the agreement calls for def's plea to count 2/dc in 14CF29 with dismissal of count 1 for joint recom of 40 days jail consecutive to any other sentences.  In 14CT16, the agreement calls for def's plea to  OWI charge for 45 days jail and $600 plus costs per the minimum guidelines, as well as 24 mo rev, 24 mo IID, with revocation to be backdated to 4-26-14 when def was revoked and placed in jail.

Def pleads no contest to count 2/dc in 14CF29 and no contest to OWI 3rd charge in 14CT16.  Court's colloquy re pleas.

Court follows jt recommendation:

40 days consecutive to any sentence serving, with good time, in 14CF29.  Also with huber.  This will be served in prison as def presently there.  Pay costs exclusive of DNA.

14CT16 - 45 days jail, consecutive to 14CF29, also to be served in prison.  With work release/huber.  $600 plus costs.  24 mo revocation.  24 mo IID upon relicensing.  Revocation backdated to 4/26/14.  AODA/driver safety plan to be relicensed.

Court allows def to set up pay plan with clerk on amounts owed in this cases as well as amount still owed in 2012 case for repayment of attorney fees to the county.  $50/mo beginning 1/1/16.  Def to fill out paperwork today.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 02-25-2015 10:00 am

Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Defendant Steven D. Beach who does not appear/incarcerated. Prosecuting Atty Amy Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Parties state they have reached resolution, request plea/sentencing. DA will produce the writ.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 25, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Final pre-trial at 03-06-2015 02:00 pm.
Jury trial at 03-12-2015 09:00 am.
email directive from Judge Sharp for this matter to be set on the jury trial calendar for the same dates as 14CT16 as a #2 to that case
Status conference at 02-18-2015 11:00 am

14CT16 and 14CF29.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Defendant Steven D. Beach. Prosecuting Atty Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Steven D. Beach not in court; presently in Jackson Correctional.  Atty. B states that the def not willing to resolve these matters per the DA's offer; asks for trial scheduling.  14CT16 is an older case; Atty. F suggests it be scheduled first.  2 days estimated.  Court sets March 9 and 10 but asks that Ms. Fields contact states re analyst availability; if not avail. Mar 9 or 10, Court could set for other days that week.  

Final pretrial Mar. 6 at 2, however, if issues are standard, that can be by telephone.

Deadline for trial status Feb. 18 at 11 - can be by phone or can be communicated to Court by Atty. Forehand.

14CF29 continued to Feb. 18 at 11 for status.  Status conference scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on December 3, 2014 at 09:00 am.
DA Harper and Atty. Bartelt (by phone).  Def is in prison, presently at the Jackson facility.  Atty. B asks for further status.  Status conference scheduled for 12-03-2014 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's
Status conference on September 24, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

14CF29 and 14CT16/status in both.  ADA Forehand in court.  Atty. Bartelt by phone.  Def does not appear as he is currently in custody at Dodge Correctional Center.  Further status requested and set.  DA's office to produce the writ for the next date - Sep. 24 at 3:30.  Status conference scheduled for 09-24-2014 at 03:30 pm.
Status conference on August 6, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

14CF29 and 14CT16/adjourned initial in both.  ADA Forehand, Def in custody on probation hold, and Atty. Bartelt.  Atty. B states that def is awaiting decision as to whether his probation will be revoked; requests status in these matters set for 30 days. 

In 14CF29, Defense waives the time limits for the prelim, preserving right to have a prelim at a later date.  Status requested and set. 

In 14CT16, Court asks for the def's pleas to OWI 3rd.  Def pleads not guilty.

Status requested and set for both matters.  Status conference scheduled for 08-06-2014 at 03:30 pm.
Atty P Bartelt
Email correspondence from PD's office. Atty Bartelt will accept this case as a public defender appointment as def. does qualify. PD will send Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel.

PD office called back and said that def would in fact be eligible for PD appointment. She is contacting  Peter Bartelt to see if he would take the PD appointment rather than the dean appointment of counsel. She will email clerk's office once she hears from Atty Bartelt.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 18, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

ADA Forehand for the State. Def via video conferencing from the jail. Def does not qualify for PD. Court will appoint Peter Bartelt. Will need to add this to payment plan currently in place. Set for AIA on June 18 @ 2:30.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 9, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

ADA Forehand appears for the State, SB appears via video/in custody. Court reads criminal complaint and maximum penalties. Def is instructed to contact the public defender's office. Matter is set for adjourned initial appearance on 05-09-2014 @ 2:00 p.m.
Written Minutes
